title: Jack Salveson
text:
John Theodore Salveson (January 5, 1914 – December 28, 1974) was a <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> <a href="pitcher">pitcher</a> who played for five seasons. He played for the <a href="New%20York%20Giants%20%28NL%29">New York Giants</a> from 1933 to 1934, the <a href="Pittsburgh%20Pirates">Pittsburgh Pirates</a> and the <a href="Chicago%20White%20Sox">Chicago White Sox</a> in 1935, and the <a href="Cleveland%20Indians">Cleveland Indians</a> in 1943 and 1945.
Salveson had a long and successful minor league career, spanning 22 years. From 1936 to 1942 and 1946 to 1953 he pitched in the <a href="Pacific%20Coast%20League">Pacific Coast League</a>, where he won 204 games. In 1942, he won 24 games with the <a href="Oakland%20Oaks%20%28PCL%29">Oakland Oaks</a>, enough to earn him a shot at the majors for the first time in eight years.
During his career, Salveson was known for his efficiency, once pitching a full game in just one hour, twenty minutes, and another time completed a game with just 54 pitches. Long-time PCL star <a href="Lefty%20O%27Doul">Lefty O'Doul</a> dubbed him "the great conservationist".
He was a good hitting pitcher in his brief major league career. He posted a .260 <a href="batting%20average%20%28baseball%29">batting average</a> (20-for-77) with 8 <a href="run%20%28baseball%29">runs</a>, 5 <a href="double%20%28baseball%29">doubles</a>, 3 <a href="home%20runs">home runs</a> and 10 <a href="RBI">RBI</a>. He recorded a .976 <a href="fielding%20percentage">fielding percentage</a> with only two errors in 83 <a href="total%20chances">total chances</a>.
Salveson also appeared in the movie "<a href="Pride%20of%20the%20Yankees">Pride of the Yankees</a>", in which he played a pitcher who hit <a href="Lou%20Gehrig">Lou Gehrig</a> (played by <a href="Gary%20Cooper">Gary Cooper</a>) in the head with a pitch.
